channel.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
channel.description:
well ive been working on this shield off and on for a couple days so i cant say its rushed nor did i make a goal to see the best model i can make in the shortest amount of time, i casually worked on snippets at a time.
well anyway, before i show anything i want feedback on it, no: cool, its good, it sucks. none of that, i want criticism.
I will be adding touches here and there and ill most likely release it because i have no use for it in a server because i dont have/want a server. But for now ill just showoff the model. And here it is...
[b][size=20pt]Front View[/size][/b] [IMG]http://i551.photobucket.com/albums/ii448/badger41badger41/shield1.jpg[/img]
[b][size=20pt]Side View[/size][/b] [IMG]http://i551.photobucket.com/albums/ii448/badger41badger41/shield2.jpg[/img]
[b][size=20pt]Another Side View[/size][/b] [IMG]http://i551.photobucket.com/albums/ii448/badger41badger41/shield3.jpg[/img]
[b][size=20pt]Wire Frame[/size][/b] [IMG]http://i551.photobucket.com/albums/ii448/badger41badger41/shield4.jpg[/img]
[b][size=20pt]Like I said before, I want good criticism or I won't learn what I've done wrong, I want to improve in the future. [/size][/b]

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
item.description:
@14-08 wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:10, topic:299753”][quote author=14-08 link=topic=396047.msg2942296#msg2942296 date=1251964568]
Um, the shape is quite simple. The sides look sharp, which i doubt it is supposed to look like. A shield should usually have a bend in the center of it. This is just sharpened, sort of. Besides the shape, the design is pretty good. I’d suggest working on the bend and shape a bit more, though.
[/quote]

the center isn’t completely flat, there is a slope but ill work on it[/quote]

Cool. I think it is great. Just put more of a bend on V2, maybe.

Read full topic

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:14, topic:299753”]Hmm, unnecessary amount of vertexes?

But yeah, it looks really great, well done. :)[/quote]

thanks, ill get to work on a lower poly version that still has good detail and ill release.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 03, 2009, 09:59:17 pm[/size][hr]Guys I’ve had to cancel that low poly shield, my computer decided to short out on me, so I’m sure the motherboard is fried along with the hard drive. I’m posting this on my g1 so I’m sure ill be without a good comp for a while.

Read full topic

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Looks nice, but it is a trace. But it is the nicest and most detailed one I have seen yet. Also, the little squigly things don’t have too much point, but are still a nice decoration. Maybe try to see if there is another kind of detail you can add, and you might be able to add more and I bet those squiggly lines take up over 100 triangles each.

Read full topic

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]

nice shield you made there

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

14-08:

Um, the shape is quite simple. The sides look sharp, which i doubt it is supposed to look like. A shield should usually have a bend in the center of it. This is just sharpened, sort of. Besides the shape, the design is pretty good. I’d suggest working on the bend and shape a bit more, though.

the center isn’t completely flat, there is a slope but ill work on it

Read full topic

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Haha that looks WAY over poly count cap for rs2 client. Dont even try lol

i bet you i can get it to fit into the rs2 client and itll still look good, but im not gonna start an argument so w.e you say

ill make a low poly version of it tomorrow but its midnight here so im gonna head off to dreamland.

Read full topic

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Haha that looks WAY over poly count cap for rs2 client. Dont even try lol

Hmm critisism… some of the faces are a little deformed. Make sure they are all aligned properly.
They get deformed (different color then the regular color you chose(Assuming your not using a texture)) when use use the ‘Create Face’ function. i strongly recomend getting into primitives because the faces wont be deformed and you will have an overall better quality model

Read full topic

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Oh alright, from the looks of the wireframe it had over 1500, sorry about that then, ignore what i said :). If my old comp worked id help you check the exact poly count, but atm its down. So im in search of a new one.

Read full topic

item.title: [look] Shield of Ages v1 [look]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

CoonHunter:

I dont believe this will fit in a rs2 client. All models posted here are supposed to be able to fit into a rs2 client.

my shield has about 1300 faces, which almost fits into the rs2 client anyway, but nothing that a little reduce polygons cant fix.

Read full topic
